item.description:
The Innovators at the Museum of Science present a brand new Forum: Clean Water & Nanotechnology - An Ocean of Uncertainty. Ensuring clean water is one of the world's most pressing environmental concerns. Researchers in the emerging field of nanotechnology are exploring ways that super-small devices can provide clean water to millions, clean up contaminated brownfield sites more economically, and help meet the globe's increasing demand for low-cost, renewable energy.This forum invites you to investigate how these new technologies may carry with them a degree of uncertainty and environmental risk. For instance, did you know that consumer products containing nanosilver and carbon nanotubes are currently unregulated? Speakers: Chad Vecitas Assistant Professor of Environmental Engineering, Harvard, and Karine Thate, Strategic Projects, MoS.

I have ten free tickets - first come, first served - but anyone else who wants to come can purchase tickets at the link below:
www.mos.org/innovatorsrsvp
tickets $50 (includes dinner and drinks) Casual business attire. Complimentary parking.
I can forward the pdf via email. Innovator events are fun!

These tickets are quite expensive, so please only RSVP "yes" if you are SURE you can come :)
item.how_to_find_us: Registration table in main lobby. Your full name will be on the guest list. Tracey will meet you in the event room.
item.name: Clean Water & Nanotechnology Forum at Museum of Science - 10 free tickets
